Job Title: Business Analyst

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Consulting, Management

Description:
Aon is looking to fill a Business Analyst role!

As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions supporting Inpoint, virtually while traveling nationwide!

Role Responsibilities

40-50% domestic travel during slower times and 50-75% during various peaks.

Participate as a team member on claims consulting projects

Responsible for assistance to project manager and team in defining solutions and developing recommendations and implementation plans

Assist project manager and delivery team in defining solutions and developing recommendations and implementation plans

Work and partner with clients to implement Inpoint’s claims solutions and interpret complex sets of client data, developing data workflows and mapping for extensive quantitative analysis on claims financial, quality, and performance data.

Construct client deliverables as they align with Inpoint’s goals and client expectations and willingness to learn industry level claims knowledge

To Be Qualified for This Role:

Bachelor's degree in business/management, mathematics, economics, or related fieldMinimum of 3-5 years of insurance claims experienceData handling and analytics, specifically with Excel PowerQuery and other third party database platformsProficiency with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)Effective verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work through complex issues utilizing data analytics and come up with various solutions to be able to present

Desired Skills (Not required, but will set you apart from others qualified):

Advanced degree (MA, MS, MBA) Third-party data platform experience (CCC, Xactimate)Experience and/or established interest in business strategy, process improvement, technology and analysis related to Financial Services or Property and Casualty claimsProficiency in analytical software such as SAS, SQL, Python, R, etc.Exposure to visualization software Qlik Sense, Tableau, Power BI

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
